abstract: New York City officials say Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration assessed each application to hold music festival in city fairly and without favor after AEG Live wins permission to hold festival on Randalls Island; AEG Live employed Harold M Ickes, longtime friend and mentor of de Blasio, to lobby for permission, and Ickes bundled around $13,000 for de Blasio's re-election campaign just before permission was given.

headline.print_headline: Friend Gave to de Blasio Just as Client Won Permit
headline.main: Friend Gave to de Blasio Just as Client Won Permit to Stage Festival

keywords.value: Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Harold M. Ickes delivered donations to Mayor Bill de Blasio’s re-election campaign the same day a client, A.E.G. Live, won approval to hold a lucrative music festival on Randalls Island.
lead_paragraph: Harold M. Ickes delivered donations to Mayor Bill de Blasio’s re-election campaign the same day a client, A.E.G. Live, won approval to hold a lucrative music festival on Randalls Island.
